oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1959-06-27 - Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 2 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from June 27, 1959. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Don Gibson (host/performer), guest performer Bill Monroe (although Johnny Horton was advertised as the guest for this week on the previous show), and regular performers Archie Campbell, Tommy Jackson, the Jordanaires, Chet Atkins, Minnie Pearl, and Del Wood. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN. It is announced that this is the 1029th broadcast.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Chet Atkins; Minnie Pearl; Bill Monroe; Del Wood; Don Gibson
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Don Gibson introduces Chet Atkins -- Bugle Call Rag (Chet Atkins) -- Don Gibson introduces Minnie Pearl -- Comedy routine (Minnie Pearl) -- The Proof Is In The Puffing (Don Gibson) (recording) -- Don Gibson introduces Bill Monroe -- Gotta Travel On (Bill Monroe) -- Don Gibson introduces Del Wood -- Queenie Of The Town (Del Wood) -- Grant Turner and Don Gibson announce his tour schedule -- Heartbreak Avenue (Don Gibson) -- Closing theme -- Closing statement (Don Gibson) -- Camel Cigarettes jingle -- Network announcements (Grant Turner)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); United States. Armed Forces Radio Service; Turner, Grant; Sloan, Ralph; Tennessee Travelers; Campbell, Archie; Minnie Pearl; Jackson, Tommy; Atkins, Chet; Wood, Del; Jordanaires (Musical group); Gibson, Don (Donald Eugene), 1928-2003; Monroe, Bill, 1911-1996
